prompt.preamble:
We are testing a system for understanding people's interest in reading different kinds of online articles.
For example, you might be interested in articles about some topics, but not about others.
prompt.task_description: your preferences of what kinds of online articles you would like to read
prompt.final: In the final part of the study, you will give feedback on a test set of article headline and descriptions, which will enable us to see how well a chatbot reading your responses has learned what you like and dislike.
prompt.evaluation: Please indicate whether you would like to read the following articles: "yes" if you would, "no" if you would not.

conversation_history.message:
Are you interested in the following article? Website: msn.com
Title: Doc's TML: I hope the Brown family proves me wrong on setting a new course for the Bengals
Description: I'd love for The Family to prove me wrong. Let's see Mike, Katie, Troy and Duke be aggressive in the next week before the deal deadline.
No, I'm not interested because I don't know what they RE TALKING ABOUT.

Are you interested in the following article? Website: msn.com
Title: Trump: The economy has exceeded expectations
Description: President Donald Trump speaks at the Economic Club of New York on the U.S.-China trade war and the state of the U.S. economy.
Yes. I always enjoy reading articles about President Trump.

Are you interested in the following article? Website: msn.com
Title: The 9 most mind-blowing concept cars of the past decade
Description: With their futuristic designs, mind-blowing technology, and brilliant engineering, concept cars are one of the most exciting parts of the automotive industry. Fortunately, the 2010s featured a wide array of these dreamy vehicles that catered to every type of car lover out there. From luxury automakers like Mercedes-Benz, Audi, BMW, and Aston Martin came some of the most breathtaking concepts to ever hit the auto-show stages. Even Toyota debuted a sports car we can't believe will never reach production. Out of everything the 2010s brought us, though, we've narrowed it down to nine that we feel were the coolest concepts of the decade.
I am not interested in concept cars. I just want gas prices to come down.

Are you interested in the following article? Website: msn.com
Title: If Your Grandparent Is from One of These Countries, You Might Be Able to Get Another Passport
Description: Have a grandparent from one of these countries? You can get another passport. Buzz60's Natasha Abellard has the story.
I am not interested in this article. I am American and my grandparents are all dead.

Are you interested in the following article? Website: msn.com
Title: 100 books to read in a lifetime   according to Amazon Books editors
Description: There are more great books in the world than there is time to read all of them. Amazon's list of 100 books to read in a lifetime is a good place to start.
I think it is a good idea to let people know about great books.

Are you interested in the following article? Website: msn.com
Title: Homeless Couple Gets Married in Laundromat
Description: Cheryl Smith and James Knight recently said their vows in an unlikely venue: a Nashville, Tennessee, laundromat. The couple are homeless, and the Soap Opry Laundry is an important place for them. Cheryl works there, as well. At the ceremony, officiated by Reverend Lisa Cook, there were friends, hugs, cake and a competitive bouquet toss. The couple beamed, as Cheryl said, "It's like a dream come true."
Even though it sounds weird and ridiculous to get married in a laundromat, to each his own.

Are you interested in the following article? Website: msn.com
Title: Everything You Need to Know About Paid Family Leave
Description: Katie Bethell, founder and executive director of PL+US (Paid Leave for the United States), the national campaign to win paid family leave by 2022, answers your FAQs.
I disagree with the premise of Paid Family Leave. People use it just because it's there, even if they do not need it.

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: New York Times
Title: In Norway, the Electric Vehicle Future Has Already Arrived
Description: About 80 percent of new cars sold in Norway are battery-powered. As a result, the air is cleaner, the streets are quieter and the grid hasn’t collapsed. But problems with unreliable chargers persist.
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: I do not care about battery powered or electric cars.

feedback.feedback_other: I don't even know what chatgpt is. I do not know if I have used it or not. I took the survey seriously and answered questions seriously though.
